concept.title: DK PIN methods
concept.shortdesc: The DK PIN methods use a PIN reference value or word (PRW) to verify PINs rather than regenerating the PIN from customer account data.

conbody.p: The PRW is generated by concatenating the customer PAN data, the issuer card data, the PIN length, the PIN, and a 4-byte random number. It is encrypted using a PRW key with the GENONLY key usage. The PRW and random number are the output of the generation. The PIN is verified by generating the PRW using a PRW key with the VERIFY key usage and comparing it against the supplied PRW and random number.
